birth_place.zh-cn: 日本萨摩藩鹿儿岛城下

description.zh-cn: 日本武士、明治维新时期的政治家，与西乡隆盛及木户孝允并称维新三杰。
description.en: Japanese samurai and politician during the Meiji Restoration, one of the three great nobles of the restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本江户时代末期（幕末）的萨摩藩武士、军人、政治家，与大久保利通及木户孝允并称维新三杰。
description.en: A Japanese samurai and statesman from the Satsuma Domain in the late Edo period, one of the three great nobles of the restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末到明治时代的政治家，与西乡隆盛及大久保利通并称维新三杰。
description.en: A Japanese statesman during the Late Tokugawa shogunate and Meiji Restoration, one of the three great nobles of the restoration.

en: Three Great Nobles of the Restoration

description.zh-cn: 对在明治维新过程中作出巨大贡献的三位政治家——西乡隆盛、大久保利通、木户孝允的并称。
description.en: A term for the three statesmen—Saigō Takamori, Ōkubo Toshimichi, and Kido Takayoshi—who made significant contributions to the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 日本在19世纪末期推行的一系列政治、经济和社会改革运动，旨在使日本现代化并摆脱封建主义。
description.en: A series of political, economic, and social reforms in late 19th-century Japan aimed at modernizing the country and abolishing feudalism.

description.zh-cn: 日本历史上最后一个封建军事政府。
description.en: The last feudal military government of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本石川县士族，刺杀大久保利通的主犯。
description.en: A samurai from Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan, and the main perpetrator in the assassination of Ōkubo Toshimichi.

description.zh-cn: 指大久保利通在东京纪尾井坂遭到石川县士族岛田一郎等人暗杀的事件。
description.en: The assassination of Ōkubo Toshimichi by Shimada Ichirō and other samurai from Ishikawa Prefecture at Kioizaka, Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本江户时代的一个藩，位于九州西南部，在明治维新中扮演了核心角色。
description.en: A domain of Japan during the Edo period, located in southwestern Kyūshū, which played a central role in the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通的出生地，位于萨摩藩。
description.en: The birthplace of Ōkubo Toshimichi, located in the Satsuma Domain.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末时期萨摩藩的实际领导人，大久保利通是其心腹。
description.en: The de facto leader of the Satsuma Domain during the Bakumatsu period, of whom Ōkubo Toshimichi was a trusted confidant.

description.zh-cn: 明治政府于1871年至1873年间派遣至美国和欧洲的外交使团，大久保利通是其主要成员之一。
description.en: A Japanese diplomatic mission sent to the United States and Europe between 1871 and 1873 by the Meiji government, with Ōkubo Toshimichi as one of its key members.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪70年代日本政府内部关于是否应出兵朝鲜的辩论，西乡隆盛是其主要倡导者。
description.en: A major political debate in Japan during the 1870s regarding an invasion of Korea, primarily advocated by Saigō Takamori.

description.zh-cn: 因征韩论引发的政治斗争，导致西乡隆盛等武断派官员集体辞职。
description.en: A political turmoil over the Seikanron debate, leading to the mass resignation of Saigō Takamori and other proponents of the invasion.

description.zh-cn: 由西乡隆盛领导的萨摩士族反对明治政府的叛乱，是日本最后一场内战。
description.en: A revolt of disaffected samurai in Satsuma against the new imperial government, led by Saigō Takamori. It was the last civil war in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 指1874年日本以琉球漂流民在台湾被原住民杀害为由，出兵攻打台湾南部原住民部落的军事行动。大久保利通作为全权大臣负责与清朝交涉。
description.en: A Japanese punitive expedition to Taiwan in 1874 in retaliation for the murder of Ryukyuan castaways by aboriginals. Ōkubo Toshimichi was appointed as the plenipotentiary to negotiate with the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清朝与日本于1874年就牡丹社事件签订的条约，由大久保利通代表日本谈判达成。
description.en: A treaty signed between the Qing dynasty and Japan in 1874 regarding the Mudan Incident, negotiated by Ōkubo Toshimichi on behalf of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 明治政府将琉球王国并入日本，设立冲绳县的过程。
description.en: The process by which the Meiji government incorporated the Ryukyu Kingdom into Japan, establishing Okinawa Prefecture.

description.zh-cn: 萨摩藩士，大久保利通之父。
description.en: A samurai of the Satsuma Domain and the father of Ōkubo Toshimichi.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通的正妻。
description.en: The legal wife of Ōkubo Toshimichi.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通的妾。
description.en: A concubine of Ōkubo Toshimichi.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通的长子。
description.en: The eldest son of Ōkubo Toshimichi.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通的次子，后过继给牧野家。
description.en: The second son of Ōkubo Toshimichi, later adopted into the Makino family.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治政府时期设立的官职，负责国内行政事务。
description.en: A cabinet position in the Meiji government of Japan responsible for domestic administrative affairs.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治政府时期设立的官职，负责国家财政。
description.en: A cabinet position in the Meiji government of Japan responsible for the nation's finances.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通是大久保利世的长子。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi was the eldest son of Ōkubo Toshiyo.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通出身于萨摩藩下级藩士家庭，并以萨摩藩士的身份效命。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi was from a lower-ranking samurai family of the Satsuma Domain and served as a Satsuma samurai.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通是萨摩藩实际领导人岛津久光的心腹。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi was a trusted confidant of Shimazu Hisamitsu, the de facto leader of the Satsuma Domain.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通对推翻德川幕府做出了巨大贡献。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi made significant contributions to the overthrow of the Tokugawa shogunate.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通对推动明治维新做出了巨大贡献。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi made significant contributions to advancing the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 早期与西乡隆盛同为萨摩藩士，共同致力于推翻幕府和推动明治维新。
description.en: Early in his career, he worked alongside Saigō Takamori as fellow Satsuma samurai, dedicated to overthrowing the shogunate and promoting the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 因征韩论问题与西乡隆盛发生政治对立，最终在西南战争中成为敌对双方。
description.en: He became politically opposed to Saigō Takamori over the Seikanron debate, eventually becoming adversaries during the Satsuma Rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 与木户孝允、西乡隆盛并称“维新三杰”，共同推动明治维新。
description.en: Along with Kido Takayoshi and Saigō Takamori, he was known as one of the 'Three Great Nobles of the Restoration,' working together to advance the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 1871年，大久保利通与木户孝允等人一同参加岩仓使节团，出使欧洲及美国。
description.en: In 1871, Ōkubo Toshimichi, along with Kido Takayoshi and others, joined the Iwakura Mission to Europe and the United States.

description.zh-cn: 西乡隆盛是征韩论的主要倡导者。
description.en: Saigō Takamori was a leading proponent of the Seikanron (Debate on Conquering Korea).

description.zh-cn: 围绕征韩论的辩论最终演变为“明治六年政变”，导致武断派参议辞职。
description.en: The debate over the Seikanron culminated in the 'Meiji-roku no Seihen,' leading to the resignation of the war-faction councillors.

description.zh-cn: 在政变中，征韩论被否决，西乡隆盛辞去参议等职务下野。
description.en: During the political crisis, the Seikanron was rejected, and Saigō Takamori resigned from his positions, including that of Councillor.

description.zh-cn: 西乡隆盛回到鹿儿岛统率士族，以“质问政府”为名发动西南战争。
description.en: Saigō Takamori returned to Kagoshima to lead the samurai, launching the Satsuma Rebellion under the pretext of 'questioning the government'.

description.zh-cn: 西南战争以政府军胜利告终，西乡隆盛在战斗中身亡。
description.en: The Satsuma Rebellion ended in victory for the government forces, and Saigō Takamori died in battle.

description.zh-cn: 岛田一郎率领六名刺客在纪尾井坂发动了对大久保利通的暗杀。
description.en: Shimada Ichirō led six assassins in carrying out the assassination of Ōkubo Toshimichi at Kioizaka.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通在纪尾井坂之变中被暗杀身亡。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi was assassinated in the Kioizaka Incident.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通作为全权大臣前往中国就牡丹社事件进行交涉，最终促成《北京专约》的签订。
description.en: As plenipotentiary minister, Ōkubo Toshimichi went to China to negotiate over the Mudan Incident, ultimately leading to the signing of the Sino-Japanese Treaty of Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 日本将《北京专约》中“保民义举”的措辞解释为清廷承认琉球为日本属地，并随后进行了琉球处分。
description.en: Japan interpreted the phrase 'a just undertaking to protect our people' in the treaty as the Qing court's recognition of Ryukyu as a Japanese territory, and subsequently carried out the Ryukyu Disposition.
